titleproper.value: Guide to the Origin Archive<lb/><date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">1951-1968</date><lb/><num>MSS 021</num> <num>MSS.021</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Processed by: Amber Creger, February 1999

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-06-14T15:57:17</date>

abstract.value: <emph render="italic">Origin</emph> was a small avant garde literary magazine that was published from 1951 to 1985. The <emph render="italic">Origin</emph> Archive consists of correspondence and manuscripts that were sent to its editor, Cid Corman, for the first 17 years of the magazine's existence.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the following form:<lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Origin Archive; MSS 021; box number; folder number; <address><addressline>Fales Library and Special Collections</addressline></address> , New York University Libraries.

<list><item> Arnold, Bob and Susan. "Cid Coreman and Origin Press." Longhouse publishers and Booksellers. 22 Jan. 2003. [http://www.longhousepoetry.com/corman.html]</item><item> Cid Corman, Papers, 1942-76 [finding aid]. Kent State University Libraries. 30 January 2003 [http://speccoll.library.kent.edu/].</item><item></item><item></item></list>

The Origin Archive consists of the correspondence received by Cid Corman concerning the avant garde journal <emph render="italic">Origin</emph>. The collection comprises original manuscripts from: Carol Berge´, Robert Creeley, Theodore Enslin, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Denise Levertov, and Gary Snyder. Copies of <emph render="italic">Origin</emph> are not part of this archive but are available to view at the Fales Library.
